intro: Elatostema angulaticaule var. angulaticaule, commonly known as the angular leaf elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a distinctive angular outline, often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
